spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The aboleth's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The deva has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The deva makes two attacks.

action.name: Celestial Hammer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 17 ({@damage 5d6}) radiant damage. On a hit, the target can't make opportunityattacks against the deva until the beginning of the target's next turn.

bonus.name: Bonus
entries: Entries

reaction.name: Self-Sacrifice
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of the thrall that the thrall can see hits an aboleth with an attack, the thrall can make itself the target of the attack instead.

legendary.name: Legendary action
entries: Entries for legendary action

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Direnaut's spellcasting ability is Wisdom. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Direnaut has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Ageless
entries: The Direnaut does not age, cannot suffer from frailty of old age, die from old age, or be aged magically.

trait.name: Fixed Helmet
entries: The Direnaut gains immunity to psychic damage, the {@condition charmed} condition, and the {@condition frightened} condition while wearing its helmet. Ability checks made to remove the Direnaut's helmet have disadvantage.

trait.name: Mutated Toughness
entries: The Direnaut reduces any non-psychic damage it takes by 12 (minimum 0 damage) after calculating resistances.

trait.name: Obscuring Visor
entries: The Direnaut has disadvantage on Perception checks while helmeted.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Dire Charge (Recharge 4-5)
entries: The Direnaut moves in a straight line up to its Speed. This movement can be through the spaces of hostile creatures and does not provoke opportunity attacks. Each creature of Huge-size or smaller in the Direnaut's path must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) bludgeoning damage on a failure, or half damage on a success. On a substantial failure a creature is knocked {@condition prone}, or on a failure by 10 or more it is knocked {@condition prone} and {@condition debilitated|LevelUp} until the start of the Direnaut's next turn.

bonus.name: Basic Maneuver
entries: The Direnaut makes a {@spell Grapple|LevelUp}, {@spell Knockdown|LevelUp}, or {@spell Shove|LevelUp} basic maneuver (dealing 7 bludgeoning basic melee damage).

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Everficer's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 18}, +10 to hit with spell attacks). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The Everficer can pass through an opening as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Ever-Hidden
entries: The Everficer is hidden from divination magic and cannot be perceived by magical scrying sensors.

trait.name: Immortal Researcher
entries: The Everficer does not age, cannot suffer from frailty of old age, die from old age, or be aged magically. In addition, she gains an expertise die on any ability check that uses a skill or tool set.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: When the Everficer fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead. When she does, her skin becomes more opaque and translucent until it can easily be seen through.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The Everficer regains 70 hit points at the start of her turn. If the Everficer takes psychic damage or damage from a spell enhanced with sorcery points, this trait doesn't function on her next turn. The Everficer dies only if she starts her turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Everficer attacks four times.

action.name: Armed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage (chosen when the Everficer attacks).

action.name: Energy Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 10} to hit, range 200/400 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) force or radiant damage (chosen when the Everficer attacks).

bonus.name: Everstep
entries: The Everficer teleports to an unoccupied space she can see within 50 feet.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The Everficer makes an attack.

legendary.name: Fool (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Everficer casts {@spell major image|LevelUp} without the need for concentration.

legendary.name: Influence (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Everficer casts {@spell charm monster|LevelUp} without the need for concentration.

legendary.name: Stagger (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Everficer casts {@spell hold monster|LevelUp} without the need for concentration.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The heshgarat cat has advantage on Perception checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: The cat's senses extend into the ethereal plane.

trait.name: Guardian of the Dead
entries: When an undead creature starts its turn or attempts to move to within 30 feet of the heshgarat cat, it must make a {@dc 11} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, it can't willingly move any closer to the cat, and while within 30 feet of the cat it has disadvantage on all attacks for the next minute. On a success, it is immune to this effect for the next 24 hours. Creatures that have advantage against being turned also have advantage on this save. Additionally, a creature with legendary actions is immune to this effect.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) slashing damage. If the target is undead, it also takes {@damage 2d4} radiant damage.

trait.name: Armoured Warhorse
entries: The pistoleer's mount has AC 14 (chain armour), but otherwise uses the statistics of a standard {@creature warhorse|LevelUp}.

trait.name: Combat Maneuvers (4 exertion/Rest)
entries: The pistoleer can spend exertion to activate the following combat maneuvers:
{@spell Cavalier stance|LevelUp} (1st), {@spell riding leap|LevelUp} (1st)

trait.name: Loading Weapon
entries: A pistol must be loaded before it can be used. The pistoleer can only make one attack with a single pistol when they use an action, bonus action, or reaction to fire it, even if they can normally make more attacks, unless they have another loaded pistol. A pistoleer can't load their pistols while mounted in combat.

action.name: Pistol (4/Rest)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Sabre
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Armoured Warhorse
entries: The pistoleer's mount has AC 14 (chain armour), but otherwise uses the statistics of a standard {@creature warhorse|LevelUp}.

trait.name: Combat Maneuvers (4 exertion/Rest)
entries: The pistoleer can spend exertion to activate the following combat maneuvers:
{@spell Cavalier stance|LevelUp} (1st), {@spell riding leap|LevelUp} (1st)

trait.name: Loading Weapon
entries: A pistol must be loaded before it can be used. The pistoleer can only make one attack with a single pistol when they use an action, bonus action, or reaction to fire it, even if they can normally make more attacks, unless they have another loaded pistol. A pistoleer can't load their pistols while mounted in combat.

action.name: Carbine
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 50/150 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d12 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Sabre
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) slashing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The high elf spell slinger is a 1st-level spellcaster. Their spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 12}, +4 to hit with spell attacks). They can cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Armoured Warhorse
entries: The pistoleer's mount has AC 14 (chain armour), but otherwise uses the statistics of a standard {@creature warhorse|LevelUp}.

trait.name: Combat Maneuvers (4 exertion/Rest)
entries: The pistoleer can spend exertion to activate the following combat maneuvers:
{@spell Cavalier stance|LevelUp} (1st), {@spell riding leap|LevelUp} (1st)

trait.name: Loading Weapon
entries: A pistol must be loaded before it can be used. The pistoleer can only make one attack with a single pistol when they use an action, bonus action, or reaction to fire it, even if they can normally make more attacks, unless they have another loaded pistol. A pistoleer can't load their pistols while mounted in combat.

action.name: Pistol (4/Rest)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Sabre
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Armoured Warhorse
entries: The pistoleer's mount has AC 14 (chain armour), but otherwise uses the statistics of a standard {@creature warhorse|LevelUp}.

trait.name: Combat Maneuvers (4 exertion/Rest)
entries: The pistoleer can spend exertion to activate the following combat maneuvers:
{@spell Cavalier stance|LevelUp} (1st), {@spell riding leap|LevelUp} (1st)

trait.name: Revolving Weapon
entries: A revolver must be loaded before it can be used. The mounted gunslinger can fire 6 shots before needing to reload. When mounted, the gunslinger can't use movement on a turn it uses an action to reload.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mounted gunslinger makes 2 attacks with their revolver.

action.name: Revolver
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 60/180 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Armoured Warhorse
entries: The pistoleers' mounts have AC 14 (chain armour), but otherwise use the statistics of a standard {@creature warhorse|LevelUp}.

trait.name: Combat Maneuvers (6 exertion/Rest)
entries: The pistoleers can spend exertion to activate the following combat maneuvers:
{@spell Cavalier stance|LevelUp} (1st), {@spell riding leap|LevelUp} (1st)

trait.name: Loading Weapon
entries: A pistol must be loaded before it can be used. The pistoleers can only make one attack with a single pistol when they use an action, bonus action, or reaction to fire it, even if they can normally make more attacks, unless they have another loaded pistol. The squad can't load their pistols while mounted in combat.

trait.name: Area Vulnerability
entries: The squad takes double damage from any effect that targets an area.

trait.name: Squad Dispersal
entries: When the squad is reduced to 0 hit points, it turns into 2 ({@dice 1d4}) {@creature Mounted Pistoleer|LevelUp|Mounted Pistoleers} with 13 hit points each.

trait.name: Squad
entries: The squd is composed of 5 or more {@creature mounted pistoleer|LevelUp|mounted pistoleers}. If it is subjected to a spell attack, or other effect that affects only one target, it takes any damage but ignores other effects. It can share its space with Large or smaller creatures or objects. The squad can move through any opening large enough for one Medium creature without squeezing.

action.name: Pistol (4/Rest)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}38 ({@damage 5d10 + 10}) piercing damage or half damage if the squad is bloodied.

action.name: Sabre
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}38 ({@damage 5d10 + 10}) slashing damage, or half damage if the squad is bloodied.

trait.name: Loading Weapon
entries: Explosive gauntlets must be loaded before they can be used. The door breaker can only make one attack with a single gauntlet when they use an action, bonus action, or reaction to use it, even if they can normally make more attacks, unless they have another loaded gauntlet.

trait.name: Specialised Weaponry
entries: The door breaker's attacks with its gauntlet have the breaker property, allowing them to deal double damage to objects and structures. They also have advantage on attack rolls against objects and structures, such as doors or barricades.

trait.name: Smoky Sight
entries: Door breakers do not suffer penalties to attack rolls, Perception checks, or other checks to navigate when engulfed in obscuring smoke.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The door breaker attacks twice using its explosive gauntlets.

action.name: Explosive Gauntlets
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) force damage.

action.name: Clear the Way
entries: The door breaker claps their gauntlets together, directing the force of the explosion in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area makes a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw, or is knocked {@condition prone}, pushed back 15 feet, and takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage and 3 ({@damage 1d6}) force damage. On a success, a creature is not pushed back or knocked {@condition prone}.

bonus.name: Reload
entries: As a bonus action, the door breaker reloads both of its gauntlets.

reaction.name: Smoke Screen (Recharge 4-6)
entries: When hit by a ranged attack, the door breaker throws a bunch of burning rags on the floor, granting them three-quarters cover until the beginning of their next turn.

trait.name: Loading Weapon
entries: Explosive gauntlets must be loaded before they can be used. The door breaker can only make one attack with a single gauntlet when they use an action, bonus action, or reaction to use it, even if they can normally make more attacks, unless they have another loaded gauntlet.

trait.name: Specialised Weaponry
entries: The door breaker's attacks with its gauntlet have the breaker property, allowing them to deal double damage to objects and structures. They also have advantage on attack rolls against objects and structures, such as doors or barricades.

trait.name: Smoky Sight
entries: Door breakers do not suffer penalties to attack rolls, Perception checks, or other checks to navigate when engulfed in obscuring smoke.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The door breaker attacks twice using its explosive gauntlets.

action.name: Explosive Gauntlets
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}3 bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) force damage.

action.name: Clear the Way
entries: The door breaker claps their gauntlets together, directing the force of the explosion in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area makes a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw, or is knocked {@condition prone}, pushed back 15 feet, and takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage and 3 ({@damage 1d6}) force damage. On a success, a creature is not pushed back or knocked {@condition prone}.

bonus.name: Reload
entries: As a bonus action, the door breaker reloads both of its gauntlets.

reaction.name: Smoke Screen (Recharge 4-6)
entries: When hit by a ranged attack, the door breaker throws a bunch of burning rags on the floor, granting them three-quarters cover until the beginning of their next turn.
